<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=3,EFW="2153144",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="7",CHK=88643,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK025:[05SEA4.05SEA1014]LR1014A.;5',USER='CKASTNE',CD='12-MAR-2005;18:54' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_ls1014_1_3"> </A> </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ls1014_washington_mutual,_inc._execut__was03540"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ls1014_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>WASHINGTON MUTUAL,&nbsp;INC.<BR>  EXECUTIVE TARGET RETIREMENT INCOME PLAN<BR>  <BR>    Effective January&nbsp;1, 2004<BR>  <BR>    PREAMBLE    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive Target Retirement Income Plan (the "Plan") was adopted by the Human Resources Committee in order to attract and retain top executive talent. The
Plan covers level 1 through 3 executives and is designed to provide retirement income of approximately 55% of final average pay for an executive with twenty-five years of service. The Plan
uses a formula that provides 6.5 times the average final five years salary and bonus, adjusted to the extent executive service is less than 25&nbsp;years, and offset by balances under other
retirement plans. The balances vest over a five year period based on executive service beginning on or after January&nbsp;1, 2004. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
January&nbsp;1, 2004, participants in this Plan are not eligible for benefit accruals under the Supplemental Executive Retirement Accumulation Plan (the "SERAP"). </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ls1014_article_i_nature_of_plan"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ls1014_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE I<BR>  NATURE OF PLAN    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>1.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Purpose</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. The purpose of this Plan is to provide retirement benefits to certain executive
employees of the Company and its affiliates that supplement the benefits accrued under the Retirement Plans. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>1.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Nature of Plan</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. The Plan is an unfunded plan maintained primarily to provide deferred
compensation benefits for a select group of management or highly compensated employees (within the meaning of sections 201(2), 301(a)(3), and 401(a)(1) of ERISA), and is intended to be exempt from
Parts 2, 3, and 4 of ERISA. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>1.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Unfunded Plan</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. This Plan is established as an unfunded plan of deferred compensation. The
compensation that is payable hereunder and interest that accrues thereon are represented solely by bookkeeping entries on accounts maintained by the Plan Administration Committee. No funds are held in
trust or otherwise segregated for the sole purpose of paying Plan benefits. All Plan benefits are payable solely from the general assets of the Company. Participants and Beneficiaries shall have no
legal or equitable rights, interest or claims in any specific collateral, property or assets of the Company, but shall be general unsecured creditors of the Company until benefits are paid hereunder.
The Company may from time to time reserve assets in a general account or grantor trust owned by the Company for the purpose paying liabilities that are accrued under this Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>_____________<BR>
End of Article&nbsp;I </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ls1014_article_ii_definitions_and_construction"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ls1014_3"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE II<BR>  DEFINITIONS AND CONSTRUCTION    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For the purpose of this Plan, the following definitions shall apply unless the context requires otherwise. Words used in the masculine gender shall apply to the
feminine, where applicable, and wherever the context of the Plan dictates, the plural shall be read as the singular and the singular as the plural. The words "Article" or "Section" in this Plan shall
refer to an Article or Section of this Plan unless specifically stated otherwise. Compounds of the word "here," such as "herein" and "hereof" shall be construed to refer to another provision of this
Plan, unless otherwise specified or required by the context. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=4,EFW="2153144",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="7",CHK=483597,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK025:[05SEA4.05SEA1014]LS1014A.;10',USER='CSTCLAI',CD='14-MAR-2005;12:36' -->
<A NAME="page_ls1014_1_4"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
determining the time within which an event or action is to take place for purposes of the Plan, no fraction of a day shall be considered, and any act, the performance of which would
fall on a Saturday, Sunday, holiday observed by the Company, or other non-business day, may be performed on the next following business day. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Accounts</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The separate bookkeeping records that are established and
maintained upon termination by the Plan Administration Committee to record any amounts credited on behalf of each Participant under the terms of the Plan. A Participant's Account shall only include
the amounts actually credited thereto by the Committee. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Annual Leadership Bonus.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The actual bonus paid under the Leadership Bonus Plan during the Plan
Year. For purposes of this Plan, Annual Leadership Bonus shall also include annual bonuses paid by Washington Mutual Advisors,&nbsp;Inc. and any other annual bonuses that are approved for inclusion
by the Human Resources Committee, in its discretion. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Beneficiary</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Any person or fiduciary designated by a Participant who is
or may become entitled to a benefit under the Plan following the death of the Participant; provided, that, in the case of a married Participant, the Participant's Beneficiary shall be the
Participant's surviving spouse unless the Participant's spouse (i)&nbsp;consents in writing to the designation of another party as Beneficiary of all or a part of the benefit to which the
Participant may become entitled under the Plan, (ii)&nbsp;such election designates a Beneficiary which may not be changed without spousal consent (or the consent of the spouse expressly permits
designations by the Participant without any requirement of further spousal consent), (iii)&nbsp;the spouse's consent acknowledges the effect of such election, and (iv)&nbsp;such consent is
witnessed by a notary public or a member of the Plan Administration Committee. Such spousal consent shall not be required if it is established to the satisfaction of the Plan Administration Committee
that such consent cannot be obtained because the spouse cannot be located (and any other circumstances the Secretary of the Treasury may prescribe by regulations). Any consent by a spouse hereunder
shall be effective only with respect to that spouse. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Change in Control</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> For purposes of this Plan, Change in Control shall
have the same meaning ascribed to that term in the Participant's Employment Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Code.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.6&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Company.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. or any successor thereto. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.7&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Committee.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The Plan Administration Committee, as it is appointed from time to time by the Human
Resources Committee of the Board of Directors. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.8&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Compensation.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> An eligible Employee's base pay and actual Annual Leadership Bonus for the Plan
Year. Compensation shall also include the portion of a Participant's Annual Leadership Bonus, if any, that has been exchanged for stock options under the Incentive Target Replacement Option Plan. For
purposes of this section, an Eligible Employee's base pay will be the base pay established for the Plan Year by the Company's Human Resources Committee. For Employees who first become eligible during
a Plan Year, base pay shall be the base pay set forth in the Eligible Employee's offer letter. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.9&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Disabled or Disability.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> A Participant is Disabled when he is determined to be disabled under the
terms of the WaMu Pension Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.10&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Eligible Employee</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Any active Employee in level 1, 2 or 3. An Employee
is considered active only if he is on the company payroll and is either working or on paid leave or vacation. Notwithstanding the preceding the Committee may, in its discretion, designate any Employee
as eligible or ineligible. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=5,EFW="2153144",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="7",CHK=1032126,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK025:[05SEA4.05SEA1014]LS1014A.;10',USER='CSTCLAI',CD='14-MAR-2005;12:36' -->
<A NAME="page_ls1014_1_5"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.11&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Employee.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Any employee of an Employer; specifically excluding, however, a person who is a
nonresident alien who receives no earned income that constitutes income from sources within the United States. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.12&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Employer.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc., and any Related Employer from time to time designated
by the Committee as an Employer, whether such designation is express or implied. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.13&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Entry Dates.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Eligible Employees will enter the plan on the later of:
(1)&nbsp;January&nbsp;1, 2004; (2)&nbsp;date of hire; or (3)&nbsp;date they became a level 1, 2 or 3 employee. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.14&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>ERISA.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.15&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Executive Service.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> All Service provided while the Employee was an Employee in level 1, 2 or 3,
served on the Company's Executive Committee, or had a title of Executive Vice President of Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. Except for purposes of vesting under Section&nbsp;3.4, service under this
section shall be credited in terms of months, and any Participant who provides services for one day in any month shall receive credit for a full month of service in that month. Employees who are not
eligible as of the end of the Plan Year but who were eligible employees at any time during the Plan Year will receive partial credit for service under the Plan solely for purposes of
Section&nbsp;3.4, only full years of Executive Service after December&nbsp;31, 2003 shall be counted. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.16&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Final Average Pay</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. For purposes of determining benefits under Article&nbsp;3, Final Average
Pay will be calculated by dividing the Participant's Compensation for the last five Plan Years by five. For purposes of this calculation, Plan Years in which a Participant was no longer an Eligible
Employee as of the end of the Plan Year ("Partial Years") shall not be counted. If a Participant has less than five Plan Years which are not Partial Years ("Full Years") then Final Average Pay shall
be calculated by dividing Compensation for all Full Years by the number of such Full Years. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.17&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Former Employee Participant.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Any individual who is a Participant, but who has terminated
employment, and who has not yet received the entire benefit to which he or she is entitled under the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.18&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Participant.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> An individual who is or has been an Eligible Employee. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.19&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Pension Plan.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The WaMu Pension Plan. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.20&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Plan.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. Executive Target Retirement Income Plan as embodied
herein and as amended from time to time. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.21&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Plan Administration Committee.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The committee specified under Article&nbsp;V, as from time to
time constituted, to be the administrator of the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.22&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Plan Year.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The fiscal year of the Plan, which is the period from January&nbsp;1 through
December&nbsp;31 of each year. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.23&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Related Employer.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Any business entity that is, along with an Employer, (i)&nbsp;a member of a
controlled group of corporations (as defined by section&nbsp;414(b) of the Code), (ii)&nbsp;a member of a group of trades or businesses (whether or not incorporated) that are under common control
(as defined by section&nbsp;414(c) of the Code), (iii)&nbsp;a member of an affiliated service group (as defined by section&nbsp;414(m) of the Code), or (iv)&nbsp;any other entity described by
Treasury Regulations promulgated pursuant to section&nbsp;414(o) of the Code. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.24&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Retirement Plans.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The sources of retirement income provided by or contributed to on behalf of
Participants by the Company or a Related Employer, including but not limited to the WaMu Pension Plan, the WaMu Savings Plan, the Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. Supplemental Employees' Retirement
Plan, and the Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. Supplemental Executive Retirement Accumulation Plan. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>5</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>

<A NAME="page_ls1014_1_6"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>2.25&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Vested Percentage</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. The percentage determined under Section&nbsp;3.4. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>_____________<BR>
End of Article&nbsp;II </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ls1014_article_iii_benefits"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ls1014_4"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE III<BR>  BENEFITS    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>3.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Amount of Benefit.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Upon termination of employment, a Participants benefit will be calculated as
follows: </FONT></P>

<TD WIDTH="4%" ALIGN="CENTER" VALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=4><B>X</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="14%" ALIGN="CENTER" VALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=4><B>Executive Service</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE><FONT SIZE=4><B> 25</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" ALIGN="CENTER" VALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=6><B>)</B></FONT></TD>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>3.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Participant's Accounts.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Upon termination of employment the Committee shall establish for each
Participant one or more Accounts, as appropriate, to which shall be allocated the proper benefit and interest accruals hereunder, less the distributions therefrom. Upon termination, the Committee
shall initially credit to each Participant's Account, the benefit set forth in Section&nbsp;3.1. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>3.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Offset Balances</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. A Participant's benefit under this Plan shall be reduced by the balances in the
following accounts and plans: </FONT></P>

Profit Sharing Contribution</FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>WaMu Pension</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

</TR>

</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2>Balances
will be established as of the most recently completed month before termination of employment. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>3.4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Vested Percentage</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. A Participants vested Percentage shall be determined using the following
table, considering only full years of Executive Service: </FONT></P>

</TR>

<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

</TR>

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>3.5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Upon Change in Control</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Upon a Change in Control a Participant will be credited with additional
years of Executive Service (either 2 or 3)&nbsp;equal to the multiplier used to calculate the payment amount upon termination after a Change in Control as set forth in the Participant's Employment
Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>6</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=7,EFW="2153144",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="7",CHK=136596,FOLIO='6',FILE='DISK025:[05SEA4.05SEA1014]LS1014A.;10',USER='CSTCLAI',CD='14-MAR-2005;12:36' -->
<A NAME="page_ls1014_1_7"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>3.6&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Interest Credited to Accounts.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Upon termination of employment, Participants who elect to receive
payment in any form other than a lump sum shall be credited with interest on the balance in their account. The rate of interest shall be equal to the rate that would have been paid by the company at
the beginning of the Plan Year had it issued unsecured junior debt with a maturity date of ten years. If the Company did not make such a debt offering at or near the beginning of the Plan Year for
which the interest rate is being determined, the Plan Administration Committee shall, in its discretion, determine this rate by reference to the following: (i)&nbsp;the rates paid on similar debt
offerings of comparably rated financial institutions and (ii)&nbsp;an estimate of the probable interest rate on such debt offering from at least one rationally recognized investment banking firm.
The Committee may, in its discretion, determine the rate for the following Plan Year at any time during the Plan Year. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>_____________<BR>
End of Article&nbsp;III </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ls1014_article_iv_payment_of_benefits"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ls1014_5"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE IV<BR>  PAYMENT OF BENEFITS    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>4.1.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Payment Commencement and Automatic Form of Payment</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. In the absence of any election set forth in
Section&nbsp;4.2, a Participant shall receive payment of the nonforfeitable balance of his Accounts as a lump sum, commencing as soon as administratively possible after termination of employment
with the Company. However, a Participant may instead elect for payments to be made pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.2, provided that the balance of his Accounts exceeds $500,000 at the time of
termination. Notwithstanding the preceding, if the Participant is a Key Employee as set forth in Section&nbsp;409A of the Code, payments shall commence no earlier than 6&nbsp;months after
termination of employment. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>4.2.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Elective Form of Payment.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Notwithstanding the provisions of Section&nbsp;4.1, a Participant
may, make an irrevocable election for payments to be made in substantially equal installments paid over a period of up to 20&nbsp;years, each such payment to be recalculated for interest that is
credited on the unpaid Account balance, provided that the Participant makes such an election at least 12&nbsp;months prior to the payment commencement date. The Participant's election under this
Section must be made prior to the time that payments would otherwise commence and at least 12&nbsp;months prior to termination of employment with the Company and all Related Employers. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>4.3.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Dishonesty.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Notwithstanding any provisions to the contrary, the Account of a Participant who has
engaged in dishonesty shall be completely forfeited. For this purpose, dishonesty means that the Participant has engaged in acts of fraud, embezzlement, theft or any other crime of moral turpitude or
has otherwise been dishonest in his or her relationship with the Employer (without necessity of formal criminal proceedings being initiated) and the Participant's employment terminated by either
discharge or resignation, all as determined by the Committee. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>4.4.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Upon Death of Participant.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Upon the death of a Participant, his vested Account balance will be
paid to his Beneficiary, as determined under Section&nbsp;6, in a lump sum as soon as administratively feasible, provided that the balance in his Accounts immediately after his death is less than
$500,000. If his balance immediately after his death is $500,000 or more, the balance will be paid in three annual installments. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>4.5.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Payment in the Event of Legal Disability.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Payments to any Participant, Former Participant, or
Beneficiary shall be made to the recipient entitled thereto in person or upon such recipient's personal receipt, in form satisfactory to the Plan Administration Committee, except when the recipient
entitled thereto shall be under a legal disability, or, in the judgment of the Committee, shall otherwise be unable to apply such payment in furtherance of such recipient's own interest and advantage.
The Committee may, in such event, direct all or any portion of such payments to be made in any one or more of the following ways: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to
such person directly; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to
the guardian or estate of such person; </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>7</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>

<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=8,EFW="2153144",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="7",CHK=958379,FOLIO='7',FILE='DISK025:[05SEA4.05SEA1014]LS1014A.;10',USER='CSTCLAI',CD='14-MAR-2005;12:36' -->
<A NAME="page_ls1014_1_8"> </A>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to
a relative or friend of such person, to be expended for such person's benefit; or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to
a custodian for such person under any Uniform Gifts to Minors Act. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>4.6.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Accounts Charged.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The Committee shall charge all distributions made to a Participant or to such
Participant's Beneficiary from and against the Accounts of the Participant when made. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>4.7.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Unclaimed Accounts.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Neither the Employer nor the Committee shall be obliged to search for or
ascertain the whereabouts of any Participant or Beneficiary. The Committee, by certified or registered mail addressed to his last known address of record with the Committee or Employer, shall notify
any Participant or Beneficiary that he is entitled to a distribution under this Plan, and the notice shall state the provisions of this Section. If Payment Commencement Date has arrived, and the
Participant or the Beneficiary fails to claim his benefits or make his whereabouts known in writing to the Committee by the date that is immediately prior to three years after the date of
notification, the Participant's Accounts shall be forfeited. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>_____________<BR>
End of Article&nbsp;IV </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ls1014_article_v_plan_administration_committee"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ls1014_6"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE V<BR>  PLAN ADMINISTRATION COMMITTEE    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>5.1.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Appointment.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The Plan Administration Committee has been appointed by the Company to administer
the Plan and serves in such capacity at the pleasure of the board of directors of the Company. The board of directors of the Company may remove the Plan Administration Committee or appoint a successor
committee at any time. If the Plan Administration Committee ceases to exist or is removed without the appointment of a Retirement committee, the Company shall function as the Plan Administration
Committee. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>5.2.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Term.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Each member of the Committee shall serve until his or her successor is appointed and
assumes membership. Any member of the Committee may be removed, with or without cause, and the board of directors of the Company shall have the power to fill any vacancy that may occur. A member may
resign upon written notice to the board of directors of the Company or the Plan Administration Committee. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>5.3.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Compensation.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The members of the Committee shall serve without compensation for services as
such, but the Company shall pay all expenses of the members of the Committee. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>5.4.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Powers of Plan Administration Committee.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The Committee shall have full and absolute discretion
in the exercise of its powers hereunder. All exercises of power by the Committee hereunder shall be final, conclusive and binding on all interested parties, unless found by a court of competent
jurisdiction, in a final judgment that is no longer subject to review or appeal, to be arbitrary and capricious. In addition to the power otherwise enumerated herein, the Committee shall have the
following specific authority: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to
direct the administration of the Plan in accordance with the provisions herein set forth; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to
adopt rules of procedure and regulations necessary for the administration of the Plan that are not inconsistent with the terms of the Plan; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to
interpret and construe the provisions of the Plan and determine all questions with respect to rights of Employees, Participants, and Beneficiaries under the Plan,
including but not limited to rights of eligibility of an Employee to participate in the Plan, the value of a Participant's Accounts, and the nonforfeitable percentage of each Participant's Accounts; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to
interpret and enforce the terms of the Plan and the rules and regulations it adopts; </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>8</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=9,EFW="2153144",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="7",CHK=905439,FOLIO='8',FILE='DISK025:[05SEA4.05SEA1014]LS1014A.;10',USER='CSTCLAI',CD='14-MAR-2005;12:36' -->
<A NAME="page_ls1014_1_9"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to
review and render decisions with respect to a claim for, (or denial of a claim for) a benefit under the Plan; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to
furnish the Employer with information that the Employer may require for tax or other purposes; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to
engage the service of counsel (who may, if appropriate, be counsel for the Employer) and agents whom the Committee may deem advisable to assist it with the
performance of its duties; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(h)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to
receive from the Employer and from employees such information as shall be necessary for the proper administration of the Plan; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to
maintain, or cause to be maintained, separate Accounts in the name of each Participant; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(j)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to
select a secretary, who need not be a member of the Committee. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>5.5.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Adjustments.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Any misstatement or other mistake of fact may be corrected by the Committee when it
becomes known, in the manner the Committee deems equitable and practicable. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>5.6.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Manner of Action.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The decision of a majority of the members of the Plan Administration Committee
shall control. In case of a vacancy on the Committee, the remaining members may exercise any and all of the powers, authorities, duties, and discretion conferred upon the Committee. The Committee may,
but need not, call or hold formal meetings. Any decision may be made or action may be taken by the Committee pursuant to written approval of a majority of the then members. The Committee shall
maintain adequate records of its decisions. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>5.7.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Authorized Representative.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The Committee may authorize any one of its members, or its secretary,
to sign on its behalf any notices, directions, applications, certificates, consents, approvals, waivers, letters, or other documents requested pursuant hereto or necessary or desirable for the
Committee to administer the Plan as provided herein, or to do any act necessary to carry out the Committee's duties and obligations set forth herein. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>5.8.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Interested Member.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> No member of the Committee may decide or determine any matter concerning the
distribution, nature, or method of settlement of his or her own benefits under the Plan unless there is only one person acting alone as the Committee. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>5.9.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Indemnity</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. The Company shall indemnify and save harmless the Committee, and its members, and
each of them, from and against any and all loss, damage, action, fee, cost, claim, liability, proceeding, or expense (including reasonable attorneys fees) to which the Committee, or its members, may
be subjected arising out of, resulting in whole or in part from, or otherwise related to any act, conduct, or inaction (except willful or reckless misconduct), in their official capacities in the
administration of the Plan. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>_____________<BR>
End of Article&nbsp;V </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ls1014_article_vi_participant_administrative_provisions"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ls1014_7"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE VI<BR>  PARTICIPANT ADMINISTRATIVE PROVISIONS    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>6.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Beneficiary Designation.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Each Participant may from time to time designate, in writing, a
Beneficiary to whom his Accounts shall be paid in the event of his death. The Plan Administration Committee shall prescribe the form for the written designation of Beneficiary and, upon the
Participant's filing the form with the Committee, it shall revoke all designations filed prior to that date by the same Participant. A Participant may designate multiple and/or contingent
Beneficiaries. If a Participant fails to name a Beneficiary, or if the Beneficiary named by a Participant predeceases him, </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>9</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=10,EFW="2153144",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="7",CHK=178076,FOLIO='9',FILE='DISK025:[05SEA4.05SEA1014]LS1014A.;10',USER='CSTCLAI',CD='14-MAR-2005;12:36' -->
<A NAME="page_ls1014_1_10"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>the
Beneficiary shall be, first, his spouse at the time of his death, or if he has no surviving spouse, then to his surviving children, the to his surviving parents in equal shares, or if the
Participant has no surviving parents, the to his estate. If the Participant dies after distributions have commenced hereunder but before a complete distribution of his nonforfeitable benefits, payment
of such benefits shall be in a lump sum to the legal representative of the estate of the last to die of the Participant and his Beneficiary. The Committee, in its sole discretion, shall direct the
Employer to whom the payments shall be made under this Section. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>6.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Personal Data to Plan Administration Committee.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Each Participant and Beneficiary must furnish to
the Committee such evidence, data, or information as the Committee considers necessary or desirable for the purpose of administering the Plan. The provisions of this Plan are effective for the benefit
of each Participant upon the condition precedent that each Participant will promptly furnish full, true, and complete evidence, data, and information when requested by the Committee. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>6.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Address for Notification.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Each Participant and each Beneficiary of a deceased Participant shall
file with the Committee, in writing, such person's mailing address, and each subsequent change of such mailing address. Any payment or distribution hereunder, and any communication addressed to a
Participant or his Beneficiary, at the last address filed with the Committee, or if no address have been filed, then the last address indicated on the records of the Employer shall be deemed to have
been delivered to the Participant or his Beneficiary on the date that such distribution or communication is deposited in the United States Mail, postage prepaid. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>6.4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Place of Payment and Proof of Continued Eligibility.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Any payment or distribution hereunder, and
any communication addressed to a Participant or Beneficiary, at the last address filed with the Plan Administration Committee, or if no address has been filed, then the last address indicated on the
records of the Employer shall be deemed to have been delivered to the Participant or Beneficiary on the date that such distribution or communication is deposited in the United States Mail, postage
prepaid. If the Committee, for any reason, is in doubt as to whether benefit payments are being received by the person entitled thereto, it shall, by registered mail addressed to the person concerned,
at the last address of record, notify such person that all unmailed and future retirement income payments shall be henceforth withheld until such person provides the Committee with evidence of
continued life and the proper mailing address for future payments. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>6.5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Assignment or Alienation.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Except as may be specified under a "qualified domestic relations
order," as defined in section&nbsp;514(b)(7) of ERISA, no benefit payable under the Plan shall be subject in any manner to alienation, sale, transfer, assignment, pledge, encumbrance, charge,
garnishment, execution, or levy of any kind, either voluntary or involuntary prior to actually being received by the person entitled to the benefit under the terms of the Plan. The Company shall not
in any manner be liable for, or subject to, the debts, contracts, liabilities, engagements, or torts of any person entitled to benefits hereunder. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>6.6&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Information Available.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Any Participant or Beneficiary may examine copies of this Plan or any
other instrument under which the Plan was established or is operated. The Plan Administration committee will maintain such documents in its office, or in such other place or places as the Committee
may designate from time to time for examination during reasonable business hours. Upon the written request of a Participant or Beneficiary, the Plan Administration Committee shall furnish him or her
with a copy of such documents. The Plan Administration Committee may make a reasonable charge to the requesting person for the copy so furnished. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>6.7&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Beneficiary's Right to Information.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> A beneficiary's right to (and the Committees' duty to provide
to the Beneficiary) information or data concerning the Plan shall not arise until the Beneficiary first becomes entitled to receive a benefit under the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>10</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=11,EFW="2153144",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="7",CHK=507012,FOLIO='10',FILE='DISK025:[05SEA4.05SEA1014]LS1014A.;10',USER='CSTCLAI',CD='14-MAR-2005;12:36' -->
<A NAME="page_ls1014_1_11"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>6.8&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Claims Procedure.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Prior to or upon becoming entitled to receive a benefit hereunder, a
Participant or Beneficiary shall file&nbsp;a claim for such benefit with the Committee at the time and in the manner prescribed thereby. However, the Committee may direct payment of a Participant's
or Beneficiary's benefits hereunder without requiring the filing of a claim therefore, if the Committee has knowledge of such Participant's or Beneficiary's whereabouts. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>6.9&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Appeal Procedure for Denial of Benefits.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The Committee shall provide adequate notice in writing
as prescribed pursuant to paragraph&nbsp;(b) below to any Participant or to any Beneficiary ("Claimant") whose claim for benefits under the Plan has been denied. </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Such
notice must be sent within 90&nbsp;days of the date the claim is received by the Committee unless special circumstances require an extension of time for
processing the claim. Such extension shall not exceed 90&nbsp;days and no extension shall be allowed unless, within the initial 90&nbsp;day period, the claimant is sent an extension notice
indicating the special circumstances requiring the extension and specifying a date by which the Committee expects to render its decision. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Committee's notice of denial to the Claimant shall set forth the following: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the
specific reason or reasons for the denial; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;specific
references to pertinent Plan provisions on which the Committee based its denial; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a
description of any additional material and information needed for the Claimant to perfect his or her claim and an explanation of why the material or information is
needed; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(4)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a
statement that the Claimant may request a review upon written application to the Committee, review pertinent Plan documents, and submit issues and comments in writing; </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(5)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a
statement that any appeal of the Committee's adverse determination must be made in writing to the Committee within 60&nbsp;days after receipt of the Committee's
notice of denial of benefits, and that failure to appeal the action to the Committee in writing within the 60-day period will render the Committee's determination final, binding, and
conclusive; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(6)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the
address of the Plan Administration Committee to which the Claimant may forward his or her appeal. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
the Claimant should appeal to the Committee, the Claimant or a duly authorized representative, may submit, in writing, whatever issues and comments the Claimant deems
pertinent. The Committee shall re-examine all facts related to the appeal and make a final determination as to whether the denial of benefits is justified under the circumstances. The
Committee shall advise the Claimant in writing of its decision on the appeal, the specific reasons for the decision, and the specific Plan provisions on which the decision is based. The notice of the
decision shall be given within 60&nbsp;days of the Claimant's written request for review, unless special circumstances (such as a hearing) would make the rendering of a decision within the
60&nbsp;day period infeasible, but in no event shall the Committee render a decision regarding the denial of a claim for benefits later than 120&nbsp;days after its receipt of a request for
review. If an extension of time for review is required because of special circumstances, written notice of the extension shall be furnished to the claimant prior to the date the extension period
commences. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>6.10&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>No Rights Implied</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Nothing contained in this Plan, or in any
modification or amendment to the Plan, shall give any Employee, Participant, or any Beneficiary any right to continue employment, or any other legal or equitable right against an Employer, or Employee
of the Employer, or against their agents, except as expressly provided by the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>11</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=9,SEQ=12,EFW="2153144",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="7",CHK=643103,FOLIO='11',FILE='DISK025:[05SEA4.05SEA1014]LS1014A.;10',USER='CSTCLAI',CD='14-MAR-2005;12:36' -->
<A NAME="page_ls1014_1_12"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>6.11&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Right To Offset For Taxes, Other Obligations</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Any payment or other distribution of benefits
under the Plan may be reduced by any amount required to be withheld by the Company under any applicable law, rule, regulation, order or other requirement, now or hereafter in effect, of any
governmental authority. In addition, if a Participant becomes entitled to a distribution under the Plan, and if at such time such Participant has outstanding any debt, obligation or other liability
representing an amount owning to the Company, then the Company may offset such amount owning it against the amount of benefits otherwise distributable to the extent permitted by applicable law. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>_____________<BR>
End of Article&nbsp;VI </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ls1014_article_vii_amendment_and_termination"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ls1014_8"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE VII<BR>  AMENDMENT AND TERMINATION    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>7.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Amendment.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The Company shall have the right at any time, without prior notice and without cause,
to amend or terminate the Plan by action of its board of directors or by action of the Human Resources Committee, provided that no such amendment may reduce the Participant's Benefit under
Section&nbsp;3.1 as of the effective date of the amendment. All amendments shall be in writing and shall state the effective date. Notwithstanding the foregoing, upon a Change in Control, no
amendment of this Plan by the Company or its successor shall have the effect of reducing a Participant's Benefit hereunder, except that the Plan may be amended to add to the list of plans that are
part of the offset under Section&nbsp;3.3 any plans that Participants become eligible for on or after the date of the Change in Control. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>7.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Termination</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Upon termination of the Plan, the Company shall pay all
benefits credited to Participants pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.1. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>_____________<BR>
End of Article&nbsp;VII </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ls1014_article_viii_miscellaneous"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ls1014_9"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE VIII<BR>  MISCELLANEOUS    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>8.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Execution of Receipts and Releases.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Any payment to any Participant, or to such Participant's
legal representative or beneficiary, in accordance with the provisions of the Plan, shall to the extent thereof be in full satisfaction of all claims hereunder against the Plan. The Plan
Administration Committee may require such Participant, legal representative, or Beneficiary, as a condition precedent to such payment, to execute a receipt and release therefore in the form determined
by the Committee. Any payment made pursuant to the power herein conferred upon the Plan Administration Committee shall operate as a complete discharge of all obligations of the Employer, the Plan
Administration Committee and the Committee, to the extent of the distributions so made. Neither the Employer nor the Committee is obliged to ensure the proper application or expenditure of any payment
so made. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>8.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Employer Records</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Each Employer shall, upon request or as may be
specifically required hereunder, furnish or cause to be furnished, all of the information or documentation which is necessary or required by the Plan Administration Committee to perform its duties and
functions under the Plan. Records of an Employer as to an Employee's or Participant's period of employment, termination of employment and the reason therefore, leaves of absent, reemployment, and
Compensation will be conclusive on all persons, unless determined by the Plan Administration Committee to be incorrect. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>8.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Evidence</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Evidence required of anyone under the Plan may be by
certificate, affidavit, document, or other information which the person acting on it considers pertinent and reliable, and signed, made or presented by the proper party or parties. Any action required
of an Employer may be by resolution of its board of directors or by any person authorized to act on behalf of the Employer. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>12</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=10,SEQ=13,EFW="2153144",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="7",CHK=64376,FOLIO='12',FILE='DISK025:[05SEA4.05SEA1014]LS1014A.;10',USER='CSTCLAI',CD='14-MAR-2005;12:36' -->
<A NAME="page_ls1014_1_13"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>8.4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Severability.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> In the event any provision of the Plan shall be held to be illegal or invalid for
any reason, the illegality or invalidity shall not affect the remaining provisions of the Plan, but shall be fully severable and the Plan shall be construed and enforced as if the illegal or invalid
provision had never been included herein. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>8.5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Notice</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Any notice required to be given herein by an Employer or the Plan
Administration Committee, shall be deemed delivered, when (a)&nbsp;personally delivered, or (b)&nbsp;placed in the United States mail, in an envelope addressed to the last address of record the
person to whom the notice is given. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>8.6&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Waiver of Notice.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> Any person entitled to notice under the Plan may waive the notice. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>8.7&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Successors</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The Plan shall be binding upon all persons entitled to
benefits under the Plan, their respective heirs and legal representatives, upon each Employer, its successors and assigns, and upon the Plan Administration Committee, and its successors. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>8.8&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Headings</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> The titles and headings of Articles and Sections are included
for convenience of reference only and are not to be considered in construction of the provisions hereof. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>8.9&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Governing Law.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> All questions arising with respect to the provisions of this Agreement shall be
determined by application of the internal laws of the State of Washington except to the extent Washington law is preempted by federal law. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>_____________<BR>
End of Article&nbsp;VII </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned officer of Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. has executed this instrument to be effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2004. </FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="84">
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(1)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1>As
defined in Item 503(d) of Regulation&nbsp;S-K. </FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(2)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1>These
computations are included herein in compliance with Securities and Exchange Commission Regulations. However, management believes that fixed charge ratios are not
meaningful measures for the business of the Company because of two factors. First, even if there were no change in net income, the ratios would decline with an increase in the proportion of income
which is tax-exempt or, conversely, they would increase with a decrease in the proportion of income which is tax-exempt. Second, even if there were no change in net income, the
ratios would decline if interest income and interest expense increase by the same amount due to an increase in the level of interest rates or, conversely, they would increase if interest income and
interest expense decrease by the same amount due to a decrease in the level of interest rates. </FONT></DD></DL>

<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="84">
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(1)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1>As
defined in Item 503(d) of Regulation&nbsp;S-K. </FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(2)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1>The
preferred dividends were increased to amounts representing the pretax earnings that would be required to cover such dividend requirements. </FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(3)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1>These
computations are included herein in compliance with Securities and Exchange Commission Regulations. However, management believes that fixed charge ratios are not
meaningful measures for the business of the Company because of two factors. First, even if there were no change in net income, the ratios would decline with an increase in the proportion of income
which is tax-exempt or, conversely, they would increase with a decrease in the proportion of income which is tax-exempt. Second, even if there were no change in net income, the
ratios would decline if interest income and interest expense increase by the same amount due to an increase in the level of interest rates or, conversely, they would increase if interest income and
interest expense decrease by the same amount due to a decrease in the level of interest rates. </FONT></DD></DL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>CONSENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>We
consent to the incorporation by reference in Registration Statement Nos. 333-23221, 333-52785, 333-81221, 333-47308, and 333-68624 on
Form&nbsp;S-4; Registration Statement Nos. 033-86840, 333-40928, 333-69503, 333-87675, 333-74646, 333-76834, and
333-106672 on Form&nbsp;S-8; and Registration Statement Nos. 333-63976, 333-67988, and 333-109921 on Form&nbsp;S-3, of our
reports dated March&nbsp;7, 2005, relating to the financial statements of Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. and management's report on the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting,
appearing in the Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K of Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004. </FONT></P>

Seattle, Washington<BR>
March&nbsp;14, 2005 </FONT></P>

<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 31.1
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#05SEA1013_12">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kg1013_exhibit_31.1"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kg1013_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 31.1    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>CERTIFICATION  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>I,
Kerry K. Killinger, certify that: </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>I
have reviewed this annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K of Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc.;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of
operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act
Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f))
for the registrant and have:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Designed
such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating
to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Designed
such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance
regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Evaluated
the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and
procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Disclosed
in this report any change in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant's most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant's
fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant's internal control over financial reporting; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant's auditors and
the audit committee of the registrant's board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>All
significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the
registrant's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Any
fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<BR>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>Date: March 14, 2005</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>/s/&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>KERRY K. KILLINGER</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><HR NOSHADE><FONT SIZE=2> Kerry K. Killinger<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Chairman and Chief Executive
Officer<BR>
of Washington Mutual, Inc.</I></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>

<TYPE>EX-31.2
<SEQUENCE>13
<FILENAME>a2153144zex-31_2.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 31.2
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#05SEA1013_13">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ki1013_exhibit_31.2"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ki1013_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 31.2    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>CERTIFICATION  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>I,
Thomas W. Casey, certify that: </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>I
have reviewed this annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K of Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc.;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of
operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act
Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f))
for the registrant and have:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Designed
such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating
to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Designed
such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance
regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Evaluated
the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and
procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Disclosed
in this report any change in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant's most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant's
fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant's internal control over financial reporting; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant's auditors and
the audit committee of the registrant's board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>All
significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the
registrant's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Any
fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<BR>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>Date: March 14, 2005</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>/s/&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>THOMAS W. CASEY</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><HR NOSHADE><FONT SIZE=2> Thomas W. Casey<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Executive Vice President and Chief
Financial Officer of Washington Mutual, Inc.</I></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

NAME="kk1013_exhibit_32.1"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kk1013_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 32.1    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>WASHINGTON MUTUAL,&nbsp;INC.<BR>
Certification of the Chief Executive Officer  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350, as adopted pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, Kerry K. Killinger, the Chief Executive
Officer of Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc., does hereby certify that this report on Form&nbsp;10-K fully complies with the requirements of Section&nbsp;13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities
Exchange Act of 1934 and that the information contained in this report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="46%"><FONT SIZE=2>Date: March 14, 2005</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2>By:</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="46%"><FONT SIZE=2>/s/&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>KERRY K. KILLINGER</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><HR NOSHADE><FONT SIZE=2> Kerry K. Killinger<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Chairman and Chief Executive
Officer<BR>
of Washington Mutual, Inc.</I></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A signed original of this written statement required by Section&nbsp;906 has been provided to Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. and will be
retained by Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. and furnished to the Securities and Exchange Commission or its staff upon request. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350, as adopted pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, Thomas W. Casey, the Chief Financial

Exchange Act of 1934 and that the information contained in this report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. </FONT></P>
